titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: MrÌ±s Dennistoun & and her daughters took their departure, being accompanied to the station by Ella & me. Then we strolled, read the Times, and "killed the time" till lunch, when we arranged to drive to Chillon. This we did; and saw the famous Chateau. It is far better worth seeing than I had expected, being indeed a fine medieval fortress, curiously dove–tailed on to the rock.
